profileText: A Representative from New York; born in Flushing, Queens County, N.Y., September 4, 1851; attended the public schools and Georgetown University, Washington, D.C.; was graduated from Oxford University, England, in 1869; studied law at Columbia Law School, New York City; paymaster general for the State of New York in 1886 and 1887; elected as a Democrat to the Fiftieth Congress (March 4, 1887-March 3, 1889); unsuccessful candidate for reelection in 1888 to the Fifty-first Congress; editor of the North American Review 1889-1896; appointed Envoy Extraordinary and Minister Plenipotentiary to the Netherlands August 12, 1911, and served to September 10, 1913; died in Flushing, N.Y., April 2, 1917; interment in Greenwood Cemetery, Brooklyn, N.Y.

creativeWork.freeFormCitationText: Bryce, Lloyd Stephens. An extraordinary experience. A new ed. New York, Chicago [etc.]: Brentano's, 1891.
------. Friends in exile. New York: Cassell Publishing Company, [1893]. New York and London: Harper & Brothers, 1900.
------. Lady Blanche's salon; a story of some souls. New York, Chicago [etc.]: F. T. Neely [1899]. Reprint, New York and London: Harper & Brothers, 1900.
------. Paradise: A novel. New York [etc.]: Funk & Wagnalls, 1887.
------. Romance of an alter ego. New York, Chicago [etc.]: Brentano's, [1889].

researchRecord.name: 1807-1895 (bulk 1882-1895), 46 items.
researchRecord.description: The collection consists of manuscripts, correspondence, and a few personal items. Manuscripts in the collection were submitted to Lloyd Bryce for publication while he worked as the editor for the North American Review. Correspondence in the collection is addressed to Lloyd Bryce and most of it concerns editorial matters. Also included are personal items of Lloyd Bryce and his wife, Edith Cooper. An unpublished finding aid available in repository and online.

researchRecord.name: In the John Milton Hay Papers, 1854-1914, 6000 items.
researchRecord.description: Includes letters to John Milton Hay and members of his family. Correspondents include Lloyd Bryce.

researchRecord.name: In the Henry Edwards Huntington Papers, 1896, 1 item.
researchRecord.description: This letter written by Castellammare di Stabia to Lloyd Stephens Bryce on June 15, 1896, criticizes Lloyd Bryce harshly for keeping Henry Huntington's article until the subject was of no immediate importance.

researchRecord.name: In the Frank D. Jackson Papers, 1895, 1 item.
researchRecord.description: A letter from Frank D. Jackson to Lloyd Bryce declining an invitation to reply to an article which appeared in the North American Review.

recordLocation.name: Special Collections Department, University of Iowa Libraries
